intro: Krascheninikovia sylvatica, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in tundra and alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to climate change, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
